ThingDef.label: Brotherhood war banner
ThingDef.description: A mounted banner of the Brotherhood of Steel, tipped with a sharp point for stabbing opponents.

ThingDef.label: power fist
ThingDef.description: The BeatCo Big Frigger is a gauntlet relying on power servomotors designed to increase the strength of the owner in unarmed combat. The device is powered by small energy cells. It lacks a kinetic energy storage device to increase knockback, unlike the super sledge, and cannot knock targets back.

ThingDef.label: Super Sledge
ThingDef.description: A hammer designed after the Great War by the Brotherhood of Steel, using the finest technology available to the order. The outline of the weapon has been streamlined and the head enclosed in a protective casing. The handle is also simplified, apparently due to the weapon being designed explicitly for use by troops in power armor. Regardless of the intent, the sledgehammer eventually made its way to the outside and appeared on the market in New California, drawing attention for its combination of good ergonomics, excellent performance, and the ability to knock enemies around like there was no tomorrow. Its performance as a tool was an excellent bonus.

ThingDef.label: Desert Eagle
ThingDef.description: An ancient Desert Eagle pistol, in .44 Magnum. Interest in late 20th century films made this one of the most popular handguns of all times.

ThingDef.label: Colt 10mm
ThingDef.description: A Colt 6520 10mm autoloading pistol. Each pull of the trigger will automatically reload the firearm until the magazine is empty. Single shot only, using the powerful 10mm round.

ThingDef.label: Mauser 9mm
ThingDef.description: A Mauser M/96 in 9x19mm Parabellum. In excellent condition. Extremely accurate.

ThingDef.label: HK 10mm SMG
ThingDef.description: Heckler and Koch MP9 submachinegun (10mm variant). A medium-sized SMG, capable of single shot and burst mode. The MP9 is easy to control, and can dish out more punishment than other firearms in its size category. Consequently, it is highly popular among people requiring a powerful, but compact source of firepower with low maintenance requirements.

ThingDef.label: Sig Sauer 14mm
ThingDef.description: A Sig-Sauer 14mm Auto Pistol. Large, singleshot handgun. Excellent craftsmanship.

ThingDef.label: .223 pistol
ThingDef.description: A .223 rifle modified and cut down to a pistol. This is a one-of-a-kind firearm, obviously made with love and skill.

ThingDef.label: .223 carbine
ThingDef.description: A .223 chambered heavy carbine, designed for big game hunting. The use of armor piercing munitions grants it an unparalleled stopping power.

ThingDef.label: Winchester City Killer
ThingDef.description: A Winchester City-Killer 12 gauge combat shotgun, bullpup variant. In excellent condition, it has the optional DesertWarfare environmental sealant modification for extra reliability.

ThingDef.label: Pancor Jackhammer
ThingDef.description: The Jackhammer, despite its name, is an easy to control shotgun, even when fired on full automatic. The popular bullpup design, which places the magazine behind the trigger, makes the weapon well balanced and easy to control.

ThingDef.label: HK G11E
ThingDef.description: This gun revolutionized squad level support weapon design. The gun fires a caseless cartridge consisting of a block of propellant with a bullet buried inside. The resultant weight and space savings allow it to have a very high magazine capacity.

ThingDef.label: Colt Rangemaster .223
ThingDef.description: The Colt Rangemaster is a powerful semi-automatic rifle chambered for .223 caliber ammunition, designed for use in hunting. After the Great War, their accuracy and power allowed them to be adapted for hunting non-traditional types of game as well. The ammunition combined with a 1:10" barrel rifling twist gives it good accuracy at range. Combination of durable metals and wooden furniture make it an exceptionally durable firearm.

ThingDef.label: AK-112
ThingDef.description: An AK-112 5mm Assault Rifle. An old and heavy military model, out of use around the time of the war. Can fire single-shot or burst, using the high velocity 5mm rounds.

ThingDef.label: DKS-501 sniper rifle
ThingDef.description: A DKS-501 Sniper Rifle. Excellent long range projectile weapon. Originally .308, this one is chambered in the more common .223 caliber.

ThingDef.label: Bozar
ThingDef.description: The ultimate refinement of the sniper's art. Although, somewhat finicky and prone to jamming if not kept scrupulously clean, the big weapon's accuracy more than makes up for its extra maintenance requirements.

ThingDef.label: Chunky Boi
ThingDef.description: The M-55 Liberator, aka "Chunky Boi", is a field machinegun originally designed for anti-air defense on heavy bombers. The ground version retains all the capacities to provide an unstoppable suppressive fire.

ThingDef.label: Browning M2
ThingDef.description: A heavy machine gun developed in 1918 and still in use right up until the outbreak of war. When loaded with rare .50 caliber depleted uranium ammo, the M2 is a particularly devastating weapon and capable of tearing apart even most armored targets.

ThingDef.label: Vindicator minigun
ThingDef.description: The German Rheinmetall AG company created the ultimate minigun. The Vindicator throws over 90,000 caseless shells per minute down its six carbon-polymer barrels. As the pinnacle of Teutonic engineering skill, it was one of the ultimate hand-held weapon in its time.

ThingDef.label: Rockwell Big Bazooka
ThingDef.description: A Rockwell BigBazooka rocket launcher. With the deluxe 3 lb. trigger. Fires Explosive Rockets.

ThingDef.label: Autocannon
ThingDef.description: A large automatic, self-loading heavy ballistic weapon that fires a high velocity hail of HE shells. Very useful to shred bodies and armors apart.

ThingDef.label: Fatman
ThingDef.description: The M42 "Fat Man" Launcher is a shoulder-fired, catapult weapon system that launches tactical nuclear ordnance, the "mini nuke". By September 2077, after one hundred test firings the weapon were complete and ready to be shipped to units overseas. Slow to operate, prone to friendly fire, the Fatman remains yet one the most devastating portable weapon on the battlefield. It quickly entered the general publics imagination, with television advertisements, magazine issues and more telling the American people about their government's latest weapon in the fight against communist China.

ThingDef.label: Holy Hand Grenade
ThingDef.description: "And Saint Attila raised the hand grenade up on high, saying, "O LORD, bless this Thy hand grenade, that with it Thou mayest blow Thine enemies to tiny bits, in Thy mercy." And the LORD did grin, and the people did feast upon the lambs and sloths and carp and anchovies and orangutans and breakfast cereals, and fruit bats and large chu... ... And the LORD spake, saying, "First shalt thou take out the Holy Pin. Then shalt thou count to three, no more, no less. Three shall be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the counting shall be three. Four shalt thou not count, neither count thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out. Once the number three, being the third number, be reached, then lobbest thou thy Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch towards thy foe, who, being naughty in My sight, shall snuff it."
